shows.title: Hauntings & Folklore / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Folklorist, historian, and paranormal researcher Rissa Miller will share how a childhood ghost sighting set her on a lifelong path of uncovering hidden stories. She believes that history, folklore, and the supernatural are not separate realms, but overlapping forces that echo and inform one another. Drawing on years of research and fieldwork, she'll discuss her investigations into haunted houses and cemeteries, as well as her exploration of urban legends, cryptids, and the enduring traditions of witchcraft and magic. Followed by Open Lines in the latter half. Give George a call and discuss whatever is on your mind!

shows.title: New World Order / Facial Analysis
shows.first_half: Joining Richard Syrett, author and researcher Allan Paul Roberts will outline what he describes as a coordinated globalist campaign to destabilize nations and pave the way for a “New World Order.” Followed by facial analyst Taylor G. Northcutt, who'll explore physiognomy, the ancient discipline that interprets personality and character through physical features, especially the face. He’ll challenge the familiar warning against judging a book by its cover.
shows.second_half: 6-10pm PT: Art Bell - Somewhere in Time returns to 2/10/98 when 'alien hunter' Derrel Sims discussed his abduction experiences and UFO research.

shows.title: EMP Dangers / Alien Encounters
shows.first_half: First Half: Historian William R. Forstchen joins George Noory to address the urgent challenge of protecting the US from electromagnetic pulse events. He’ll explain how EMP bursts, whether triggered by hostile actors or solar activity, could cripple the power grid and dismantle the infrastructure modern life depends on.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Filmmaker James Fox shares the latest findings from his investigations into alien encounters. Among the cases he’ll examine is an extraordinary account from a neurosurgeon who claims to have witnessed face-to-face contact with a captured living ET at a regional hospital in Brazil in 1996.

shows.title: EMF Research / UFO Disclosure
shows.first_half: First Half: Daniel DeBaun, an expert in EMF radiation and shielding technologies, will explore the unseen energies he believes are influencing modern life. He’ll examine new initiatives aimed at addressing gaps in EMF research, and explain how electromagnetic fields interact with cellular biology and why designing a “bedroom sanctuary” may be key to improving sleep quality.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Author and UFO contactee Whitley Strieber will reflect on what disclosure might look like if it occurs, and how the themes in his books connect to that possibility.

shows.title: The Technocracy System / Astrology in 2026
shows.first_half: First Half: Economist and financial analyst Patrick Wood will examine a proposal advanced by prominent scientists and engineers for a utopian system called Technocracy. The concept envisions an energy-based system managed by scientific experts rather than elected officials, a vision Wood has long scrutinized and challenged.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Astrologer Maria Shaw will turn her gaze to 2026, describing it as a "Reset Year" through an astrological lens. She’ll explore why she believes both individuals and society at large are entering a cycle of breakdown and renewal, and discuss the upcoming Lunar Eclipse and the shifts it may signal.

shows.title: Death & Grief / Spirit Guides
shows.first_half: First Half: Death and grief researcher David Kessler shares his understanding of the profound and often mysterious experiences surrounding dying and bereavement. He’ll reflect on the emotional and spiritual dimensions that can surface when loss enters our lives, and explain his concept of the "Sixth Stage of Grief."
shows.second_half: Second Half: Psychic medium and channel Leanne Thomas will discuss angels, guides, and departed loved ones she refers to collectively as “Your Spirit Team.” She’ll offer her perspective on navigating what she sees as a period of energetic transition on Earth, and offer insights into intuition and dreams.

shows.title: Zodiac Killer Revisited / Transforming Our Lives
shows.first_half: First Half: Author and former 911 first responder Eddie McNamara argues that the Zodiac Killer was not a single elusive predator, but a myth stitched together from unrelated crimes, and amplified by media coverage. Drawing on his background in policing, he'll revisit original case files and newspaper reports he believes have been overlooked.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Nick Jankel is an authority on unlocking and integrating meaningful change, innovation, and transformation in our daily existence. He'll discuss human consciousness and its place in our lives, as well as ways to actively expand and transform to our changing realities.

shows.title: Tarot & Psychology / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Art Rosengarten, Ph.D. has been a practicing Jungian psychologist for 50 years. He is a speaker, seminar leader, and author of four nonfiction works on the psychology of modern tarot. He'll present a therapeutic approach to tarot card readings and delve into Carl Jung’s synchronicity (the chance selection of cards). Followed by Open Lines in the latter half. Give George a call and discuss whatever is on your mind!
